CHAPTER 1 
 ON A MORNING in mid-April, 1687, the brigantine Dolphin left the open sea,
 sailed briskly across the Sound to the wide mouth of the Connecticut River 
 and into Saybrook harbor. Kit Tyler had been on the forecastle deck since 
 daybreak, standing close to the rail, staring hungrily at the first sight of land 
 for five weeks.
